intro: Borreria peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian burr. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Peru and Bolivia. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Borreria peruviana is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
